page.title: 10Local History
page.content: Weston Patrick: A fire in 1886 destroyed 12 cottages and a private house. 47 people were made homeless but there was no loss of life. Place Names: Weston Patrick is named after Patrick de Chaworth and Weston Corbett after Thomas Corbett both of whom held the land in the 13th Cent. A house in Weston Patrick is called "The Case is Altered". Various explanations for the origin of the name have been put forward but the most probable explanation is that it is on the site of a public house started up by veterans returning from the Peninsular War and named Casa de Saltar,Casa Alta or Casa Alta Douro and later the name became anglicised.
